Package com.rb.nonbiz.math.vectorspaces

Class RBSquareMatrix

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.math.vectorspaces.RBMatrix
com.rb.nonbiz.math.vectorspaces.RBSquareMatrix
public class RBSquareMatrix
extends RBMatrix
An immutable square matrix.

We went back-and-forth between using inheritance and object composition, and settled for the latter. Even though this is clearly an "is a" relationship, composition is useful because it saves us from having to duplicate some preconditions. Plus, it hides some methods: RBMatrix.getNumRows() and RBMatrix.getNumColumns() were replaced with the more explicit getNumRowsOrColumns().

See Also:
RBMatrix

    • getNumRowsOrColumns

      public int getNumRowsOrColumns()
      An n x n matrix is officially called a square matrix of order n. However, because the word 'order' can mean ordering, or (OK, that's a stretch) even buy/sell order, let's just have a clearer name, even if it's not official.
